page.title: 10Cycling in Cambridge
page.content: In Cambridge there are so many cyclists that special lanes have been marked on the roads for them to travel along,for example,the one on Hills Road,over the bridge. In 1982,a traffic light was installed to control one of these lanes to stop accidents. Many people were getting knocked off their bikes particularly when they changed traffic lanes. Because it is a University town, Cambridge has a greater bicycle popul- ation than most. The students find it a quick,cheap way to travel between the different colleges which make up the University, and during term time you can see hundreds of them weaving their way through the traffic, trying to get to their lectures on time. A great many tourists also hire bicycles as it is an ideal way to ex- plore Cambridge.
